channel.title: BUbuisnessAndMarket
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbuisnessAndMarket, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Honeywell CEO: AI will transform industry at scale beginning in 2025
item.description: Think autonomous, not automated, operations as the industrial sector embraces the trifecta of AI, 5G, and the cloud.

item.title: Johnson & Johnson strikes $15 bln deal for schizophrenia drug maker
White House releases new rules limiting AI chip exports opposed by industry
Southwest is the latest big firm to choose a CFO search over succession planning
item.description: Tammy Romo, EVP and CFO at Southwest Airlines, will retire on April 1.

item.title: Dow futures point to further losses as bond yields rise
Vaccine maker Moderna’s stock plummets in premarket to April 2020 levels
Meta’s oversight board blindsided by Mark Zuckerberg’s decision to relax hate speech restrictions
item.description: Michael McConnell fears the decision by Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg to eliminate fact checking will not work.

item.title: Walmart is getting its first logo ‘refresh’ in 17 years—and its marketing chief explains why
item.description: The company hopes to make the Walmart spark as recognizable as Apple's logo and Starbucks' mermaid.

item.title: Planters will pay you $45,000 a year—plus health benefits, travel expenses and a 401(k)—to drive the NUTmobile around the country
item.description: Job start date is in June.

item.title: Nvidia’s stock is sharpest Dow decliner after Biden imposes export restrictions
